intro: Achoriphragma pjataevae, commonly known as the Pjataev's achoriphragma, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky outcrops. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
